text: NF-kappaB only partially mediates Epstein-Barr virus <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation of B cells .

The <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) of Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) is required for EBV - induced immortalization of human B cells and causes tumorigenic transformation of cell lines .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression induces phenotypic changes resembling B cell activation , such as cell size increase and up-regulation of cell surface activation markers .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contains two domains that activate the transcription factor NF-kappaB , one through interactions with TRAF proteins and the other with the TRADD protein .

The purpose of the present study was to investigate the importance of NF-kappaB induction in the up-regulation of the B cell activation markers <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD71 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: This study shows that expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates transcription from <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive promoters , and that this activity can be completely inhibited by expression of a dominant inhibitory IkappaB mutant .

<extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD71 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are nevertheless up-regulated by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in primary B cells and cell lines expressing the dominant IkappaB .

text: Furthermore , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced cell size increase of primary B cells was unaffected by IkappaB expression .

It was concluded that even when <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is unable to activate NF-kappaB , it is still capable of inducing certain characteristics of activated B cells , strongly suggesting that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can also activate cells independently of NF-kappaB .
